title: CCC: Cardano Multiversity MVP
description: **CCC will provide meaningful, memorable, motivational learning & skills transference experiences w/measurable results, currently non-existent**

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal contains no details on how it would be delivered. The video linked also contains no relevant information, just being a 2 minute video stating L&D is important.
Please present I viable proposal of what would be delivered for the requested 150,000 and how it would improve the developer ecosystem
f6_assessments.q1: No plan or experience presented, thus will not be successfully delivered.
f6_assessments.q2: No information provided, no timeline, no deliverables, no scope. There is nothing about this that would allow progress to be audited. Please present an actual proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
An effective training regime is a critical requirement to build a cohort of developers who can take on the challenge. There is a need to develop an established approach for curriculum development than Adhoc/makeshift approach. The proposal presents a Multiversity approach which presents a clear case for evolving an effective training regime.
In the long run, Cardano will greatly benefit if it hosts a vell structured training that has been designed and implemented by a dedicated team of professionals.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal claim steller success stories on the website. The claimed credentials and the size of the team proposed for deployment are sufficient to establish that the proposer has a professional experience to implement the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The work proposed has been divided into 8 phases (Kickoff, Savvy Start,
Savvy Start Summary, Design Proof, Pre- Alpha Content, Alpha, Beta, and gold. Each phase has a clear goal and a schedule too full. The project has been well structured and is auditable. The amount of money that has been asked is large however, with the scope of study and the quality of the manpower required to design a adaptive curriculum, the estimate seems fine.

f6_assessments.q0: This team is asking for funding to explore, define and then creating a learning system for the Catalyst/Cardano community. Some question arise here: Where is the additional value compared to initiatives that are already existing in this community? Why not support/join them instead of building something else? In terms of an efficient and responsible use of the treasury this would increase the impact of our learning initiatives in the developer ecosystem. In addition, there is no directly linkage to the goals of the challenge mentioned (the name doesn't even appear). 3 stars – based on the presented information.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team is well known in the community. However, the roles in this project are not defined. The presentation contains more elements of a general sales pitch like methods and capabilities) instead of presenting a ready-to-solution. Yes, I understand that this budget is used for exploration and defining a learning system. Setting the requested amount in relation to existing initiatives (which are already executing) it doesn't seem reasonable. As the outcome of this proposal is not clear yet, the main question is: Will we like the outcome, do we want it then? In order to get a better rating, I want to know what exactly the community is getting. For this amount, there should be more clarity about the outcome.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a timeline and a roadmap defined. But we don't know what to expect. If there would be at least some kind of documentation source to observe/track ongoing activities at least some auditability would be possible. Talking about new reward system e.g. without explaining what they going be like, doesn't make this very proposal auditable. Also there is no comment about challenges and risks that might occur among that process.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has promising outlook but more information needs to be implemented in this proposal. The external links present a rather general solution to the problem posed here but lacks in expanding how it will reach the target audience sucessfully and to what gain to the community at large. Education is paramount but more information regarding how 150k of funds are used and a stage by stage timeline of the scope.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience in education appears extensive and valuable, the way is delivered and to whom is quite narrowed in approach. How is AI is especifically relevant in the solution and how it engages with the students.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunantely is not as clear to establish confidence in its delivery. Is a huge fund amount and there are no key metrics presented nor timelines to assess how sucessfully it will be developed.

solution: **"Cardano Multiversity" will provide engaging interactions, focused on accelerated, artificially intelligent, targeted developer education.**
